Welcome To uGet Chrome Wrapper
uGet Chrome Wrapper
Tell Me More

Introduction

We integrate the best download manager with the best web browser.

uGet

uGet is an Open Source download manager application for GNU/Linux developed with GTK+, which also comes packaged as a portable Windows application.

Google Chrome, Chromium, Vivaldi & Opera

The fast, secure, and free web browsers built for the modern web. uGet Integration extension is available for all these browsers.

Linux & Windows

This project is an attempt to fill the gap in download accelerators available for Linux. However, setup for Windows is available for people using uGet in Windows.

Installation

Requires Python 3.4 or latest and latest uGet (2.0.8 or latest)

Ubuntu

Ubuntu and its derivatives

Arch

Install via Arch User Repository

Any Linux Systems

Manual installation for Google Chrome & Opera

Any Linux Systems

Manual installation for Chromium & Vivaldi

Windows

Setup for Windows

Features

Currently available features of uget-chrome-wrapper

  • Browser Integration

    Accelerate all your downloads

    uGet Download Manager with aria2 plugin accelerates the downloads equal to IDM & XDM. With uget-chrome-wrapper all you need to do is simply clicking on the download links. You can right click on links and download with uGet even if the extension is temporarily disabled by you.

  • Skip uGet

    Prevent uGet from interrupting

    Sometimes downloading using the browser is a prefereable option. In such case press and hold the Insert key to prevent uGet from interrupting your download. To temporarily disable & enable uGet Chrome Wrapper, use Ctrl + Shift + U.

  • Downloading youtube videos?

    No you can't but still you can

    If I provide Youtube downloader along with the extension, Google will black list the extension from Chrome webstore and which will make installation more complex. There are experts like Savefrom.net in grabbing Youtube download links; uget-chrome-wrapper can grab from them ;-).

  • Filter URLs

    Exclude URLs using keywords

    This is another form of skiping URLs from being interrupted by uGet Chrome Wrapper. Provide keywords separated by comma in Exclude URLs containing: box. uGet will let your browser to hanlde URLs containing any of those keywords.

  • What else?

    This is just the start of the journey

    I develop this project as one of my leisure time project and I will continue to add more features. However, please forgive me for the slow development lifecycle due to my busy schedule.

  • This is
    all
    I have

Ubuntu

Linux Mint is the development environment of uget-chrome-wrapper so all features are tested in Ubuntu environment. To integrate uGet with Google Chrome/Chromium/Vivaldi/Opera, follow the steps given below.

  1. Add the PPA:
    sudo add-apt-repository ppa:slgobinath/uget-chrome-wrapper
  2. Download the package list:
    sudo apt update
  3. Install uget-chrome-wrapper:
    sudo apt install uget-chrome-wrapper
  4. Install the uGet Integration extension - Google Chrome, Chromium & Vivaldi users: Chrome Extension Opera users: Opera Extension
  5. Restart the browser


Tested Environments

Ubuntu 14.04, uGet 2.0.9, Google Chrome 56.0.2924.87
Linux Mint 18.1, uGet 2.0.9, Google Chrome 56.0.2924.87
Linux Mint 18.1, uGet 2.0.9, Vivaldi 1.7
Linux Mint 18.1, uGet 2.0.9, Opera 43.0


Arch

Arch PKGBUILD is created by Sasau. To integrate uGet with Google Chrome/Chromium/Vivaldi/Opera, follow the steps given below.

  1. Install uget-chrome-wrapper via AUR
    packer -S uget-chrome-wrapper
    or 
    yaourt -S uget-chrome-wrapper
  2. Install the uGet Integration extension - Google Chrome, Chromium & Vivaldi users: Chrome Extension Opera users: Opera Extension
  3. Restart the browser


Tested Environments

Arch Anywhere 2.2.3, uGet 2.0.8, Vivaldi 1.4.589.38


Any Linux Systems

Any Linux system with Python 3.4 or latest must be able to run uget-chrome-wrapper. To integrate uGet with Google Chrome & Opera, follow the steps given below.

  1. Download the uget-chrome-wrapper to /usr/bin:
    sudo wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/slgobinath/uget-chrome-wrapper/master/uget-chrome-wrapper/bin/uget-chrome-wrapper --output-document /usr/bin/uget-chrome-wrapper
  2. Make the uget-chrome-wrapper executable:
    sudo chmod +x /usr/bin/uget-chrome-wrapper
  3. Create a new directory native-messaging-hosts if not exists:
    sudo mkdir -p /etc/opt/chrome/native-messaging-hosts
  4. Download the com.javahelps.ugetchromewrapper.json to that directory:
    sudo wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/slgobinath/uget-chrome-wrapper/master/uget-chrome-wrapper/conf/com.javahelps.ugetchromewrapper.json --output-document /etc/opt/chrome/native-messaging-hosts/com.javahelps.ugetchromewrapper.json
  5. Install the uGet Integration extension - Google Chrome users: Chrome Extension Opera users: Opera Extension
  6. Restart the browser


Tested Environments

Ubuntu 14.04, uGet 2.0.9, Google Chrome 56.0.2924.87


Any Linux Systems

Any Linux system with Python 3.4 or latest must be able to run uget-chrome-wrapper. To integrate uGet with Chromium & Vivaldi, follow the steps given below.

  1. Download the uget-chrome-wrapper to /usr/bin:
    sudo wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/slgobinath/uget-chrome-wrapper/master/uget-chrome-wrapper/bin/uget-chrome-wrapper --output-document /usr/bin/uget-chrome-wrapper
  2. Make the uget-chrome-wrapper executable:
    sudo chmod +x /usr/bin/uget-chrome-wrapper
  3. Create a new directory native-messaging-hosts if not exists (This path is common for both Chromium and Vivaldi):
    sudo mkdir -p /etc/chromium/native-messaging-hosts
  4. Download the com.javahelps.ugetchromewrapper.json to that directory:
    sudo wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/slgobinath/uget-chrome-wrapper/master/uget-chrome-wrapper/conf/com.javahelps.ugetchromewrapper.json --output-document /etc/chromium/native-messaging-hosts/com.javahelps.ugetchromewrapper.json
  5. Install the uGet Integration extension - Chromium & Vivaldi users: Chrome Extension
  6. Restart the browser


Tested Environments

Manjaro 16.10.3 Fringilla, uGet 2.0.8, Chromium 56.0.2924.87


Windows

Windows is not our main target because of extra testing effort requried. Therefore uget-chrome-wrapper for Windows may get the updates and bug fixes bit later than the Linux version. To integrate uGet with Google Chrome/Chromium/Vivaldi/Opera, follow the steps given below.

  1. Install Python 3.4 or latest
  2. Add uGet bin folder to the path (Open the screenshot in a new tab for clear image)
  3. Download and install uget-chrome-wrapper_2.0.2.exe
  4. Install the uGet Integration extension - Google Chrome, Chromium & Vivaldi users: Chrome Extension Opera users: Opera Extension
  5. Restart the browser


Tested Environments

Windows 10, uGet 2.0.8, Google Chrome 56.0.2924.87
Windows 10, uGet 2.0.8, Vivaldi 1.7
